conversations.content: So this is the Halidom...
Daaang. Talk about some sweet digs.
Ah, hello! You must be Farren and Lil' Barb.
I'm Euden, and it's a pleasure. Grace told me all about the pair of you.
It sounds like you've been through a lot. Between being captured by the Syndicate and all the awful things they put you through... I can't imagine.
Yeah... Can't say they left me with any happy memories, that's for sure.
The people I met died one after another, and yet I somehow kept surviving...
I'm terribly sorry to hear that, Farren.
But you know what? That's exactly why I can't just sit around moping all day!
I've gotta do my best and keep pushing on for all the people who can't anymore!
You're very strong, Farren.
Nah. He's just too thickheaded to let anything drag 'im down too long.
Ha ha. Well, in any event, it's certainly better than being downcast.
This castle is a safe place. You don't need to worry about the Syndicate anymore, so please, make yourself at home and relax.
You better believe I will! Thank you so much, Euden. You've made me feel really welcome!
And there...we go. Phew. Doing the washing has become quite the gargantuan undertaking around here, I must say.
Laundry day, huh? I'll help you dry it.
Ah, you're the newcomer, if I'm not mistaken. Your kind offer is appreciated, but I can take care of it myself, thank you.
I heard that you've had quite the difficult experience. Please, take it easy and rest.
I'm grateful for the consideration, but I'm not the kinda guy who can just sit around.
I'd much prefer to be helpful to somebody!
So c'mon, let's get these slacks and shirts or whatever nice and dr—WHOA, hold up! You clothing an entire army here, or what? We're gonna be here all day!
Hee hee. You're a curious young man. You say something like that, but there you are hanging the laundry with a smile on your face.
I mean, what's not to smile about? I'm alive, y'know. And today's looking like another peaceful day. Can't complain.
Yes... I suppose you're right.
Being able to focus our attention on such a mundane task is proof positive of peace.
'Kay, now that we're done with the wash, the neeext thing I can do to help out is...
Hey, hold up. Sounds like there's some kinda fuss over there.
Ranzal, the western forest!
Got it! I'll knock some fiend heads off!
There are fiends out? C'mon, Lil' Barb. We'll fight too!
Uhhh... You sure? Pretty sure we could just leave it to them...
The people here helped us out a lot. We have to return the favor. C'mon!
Hey, don't go chargin' off alone! ...Aaand the kid's gone.
Sheesh. Try lettin' a guy finish his sentence next time. Ah well. He's right—ain't cool to leave debts unpaid.
Found the fiends! Come on, Ranzal!
Haaah!
Huh? Isn't that—
Let me in on the action, Euden!
Hey now, don't push it! You ain't even trained in fightin' or anything, are ya?
It's all good! I've got this power of mine, after—wait. Lil' Barb?
Graaargh!
Uwaaagh!
Watch it, kid! Get down!
Gee, if only SOMEBODY had warned ya, Farren. You can't fight by yourself, y'know.
There you are! Took you long enough!
You're the one takin' off at full tilt. Got a little more appreciation for my value now?
Yeah, yeah. Message heard.
Ya sure?! 'Cause it sure don't seem like it!
Come on, let's just do this already!
Wyrmbinding, activate!
Farren... The way you look now— is that what the Syndicate did?!
Yup. This is the damnable power those Syndicate pukes foisted on us. Wyrmbinding.
Yeah, but as long as we have it, we can PROTECT people!
And that's exactly how I've decided to use it—not for myself, but for others!
Farren...
All right. Let's do this thing, Lil' Barb! Haaah!
...That takes care of that. You were a big help, Farren.
For real. I kinda figured we'd have to protect ya, what with you bein' a Syndicate victim and all, but I guess I was wrong.
Yer still a greenhorn when it comes to the WAY ya fight, but you got some guts, kiddo. Ranzal's seal of approval: granted!
And mine as well. We're lucky to have you, Farren.
Awww. Heh. I promise I'll keep giving everything I've got!
A few days later...
Hooo-wheee... Another day...of giving everything...I've got...
Yo, Farren! If you're gonna sleep, ya could at least do it in a BED!
Zzz...
...Aaand he's dead to the world.
Sheesh. He's pushin' himself too far. Pitchin' in with chores, rescuin' people in trouble, helpin' kill fiends...
Why's he so hell-bent on this selfless schtick?
Here you are: a nice slice of berry pie to beat that midday sugar crash.
HECK yeah. This looks delish! I'll help myself to Farren's portion while I'm at it.
Oh, is he not here?
Guy's got no time to spare right now. He's runnin' all over the place meddling, except, y'know. Helpfully.
And since he's tied up, that means it's cool for me to take the whole pie for myself, right? Right!
No. We're saving a piece to give Farren later.
What? Come onnn...
And so you have arrived, Lil' Barb. What shall we play today? Cards? Dice?
Cards! I owe you for yesterday!
Heh heh. Bluster all you want, but you may well find yourself in trouble again today. You sure you're up for it?
A needless question. It's not a matter of winning or losing. We're here for the thrill. ...Right, pal?
Yeah, I hear ya! But either way, I'M bringin' home the bacon today! Figuratively. ...I'm gonna win.
I'm baaack! Oh man, this Halidom place is the BEST. The food's to die for, and there's all sortsa shenanigans I can get up to.
It's like night and day from those miserable days we spent with the Syndicate. Don't ya agree, Farren?!
...Hold up. He's STILL not back?
Day in, day out, from sunup to sundown, he's out there doin' stuff for other people.
Why? We're finally free from the Syndicate. The kid oughta be goofin' off and doin' whatever he wants...
A few days later, in the middle of a fiend hunt...
Haaah!
Hrk! Be careful, everyone. This fiend is strong!
It'll be dangerous to try'n take it head on. We should skirt around and strike from the back. That oughta bring 'er down quick.
Easier said than done. Doesn't seem like we got any chance TO get behind it!
Then we just gotta MAKE an opening. I'll go get its attention.
But that'll put you in danger!
If anyone's gonna be bait, it should be me. This body of mine's sturdier than a normal person's.
Come on, don't worry about me. I was a merc—got real used to doin' this sorta thing in those days.
Fightin' comes about as easily to me as wipin' my backside. I know all the tricks— not necessarily to win, but to get outta any sorta scrap alive.
It IS dangerous, but I trust you, Ranzal.
That's what I like to hear. Now c'mon— y'all separate out from me and watch for a chance to make your move!
Got it... Be careful, Ranzal!
Oh YEAH! Time to DO this! HRAAAH!
All righty... Heh. If I focus on my defense, attacks like these won't—
Whoa there! This thing's a little scrappier than I was thinkin' it'd be.
What?! Oh, crap—!
Watch out, Ranzal!
Uwaaagh!
Idiot! You're supposed to let ME take the hits here!
Farren! Lil' Barb! You guys okay?!
Owww... Er, yeah! No sweat! Like I told you, I'm tough.
Now, come at me, fiends! Give me your best shot!
I don't know what kinda idiotic pride thing you're tryin' to do, but quit gettin' knocked around and let MY part of the body take the hits, Farren!
Graaagh!
Not a chance! Haaah!
Graaagh!
Phew... We managed. Farren, are you sure you're really okay?
Yep! Peachy keen!
I see. Good. Nevertheless... I have to say that what you did back there scared me.
Er, sorry about that! My body just kind of moved on its own when I realized that Ranzal was in danger.
I'm grateful for you helpin' me out there, but seriously, you're bein' way too reckless. You've only got one life to lose, y'know.
But...that's the only way I'm able to be of any use to anybody...
Farren...
Anyway, I promise I'm okay! See? No big injuries or anything.
...Yo, Farren. What's the deal?
Did you deliberately take that hit from the fiend on the human side of your body?
Oh, uh...yeah. If I had taken it from the right side, it might've hurt you, so—
Look, kid. I was MADE to be a shell. I'm tough. Tougher than you, at the very least.
So just...don't do that kinda stuff. Let me soak the damage. You feel me?
Hello? Grastaea to Farren?
Oh, sorry! I just...never would've thought that you worried about me like that.
Don't BS me, kid! I've had it up to here fightin' with someone who won't actually trust in me!
Wait, no, it's not that I don't trust you—
Like hell it ain't. You're tryin' to do everything on your own. You're reachin' for cookies on the top shelf, and you ain't as tall as you think you are.
And there's nothin' I hate MORE than being underestimated, dammit!
What he said. You can't be surprised if the folks around you start doubtin' your faith in them when you go around sacrificing yourself willy-nilly.
Yes. You can rely on us more.
I... Yeah. Yeah, you're right. I'm sorry, Lil' Barb.
Good, so you get it now? There ain't gonna be a next time.
I know. I'll watch it.
...You do that. Sheesh.
(Can't say he has me convinced. This IS Farren we're talkin' about.)
Aw, man... We're completely lost. I thought you said that going through the forest would be a shortcut, Lil' Barb.
It IS a shortcut. Whether or not you get lost once we're inside ain't my responsibility.
Sheesh. Always with the jabs. Ah, well. I still don't know where we actually are, but at least we've found our way to a village.
We should be able to ask one of the locals which way to go, and—huh? Hey, Lil' Barb. Is something, I don't know...off...to you about this place?
Now that you mention it, it's weirdly quiet. And I don't see a single soul around.
I've got a bad feeling about this. Let's take a look around the village.
Heeeeey! Is anyone here?
*sniffle*
Was that a child crying?! Where'd it come from?
There, look—there's a kid up in the tree!
Hey mister, please help! Help my mom and dad!
Some weird people in masks came, and... And they took Mom and Dad and everyone else somewhere!
People in masks?! No... It couldn't be!
No two ways about it. It's the Syndicate. They probably made off with the people to do another one of their creepy-ass, good-for-nothin' experiments.
That's terrible! We have to go and help them, Lil' Barb!
Did I not explicitly say to hold your damn horses? We don't even know where they got hauled off to. First we gotta figure out what to do.
Hey, kid. D'you see which direction they dragged the good folks away?
Um, yeah! It was...to the eastern forest!
Got it. I promise you, we'll get your loved ones back! So just wait here and rest easy!
C'mon, Lil' Barb!
...Sheesh. Kid's just goootta stick his nose into every little mess we come across.
See that? Syndicate goons. Looks like the people they kidnapped are in there. What's our game plan?
It's the brute-force option, but I think we should charge right in. We don't want to give them an opportunity to make any of the villagers into hostages.
Tch. Yeah, figured it'd be somethin' like that. You're right, though—it'd be a huge pain if they dragged one of the villagers out to threaten us.
(Especially with you, kid. There's no tellin' how you might mess things up if someone's life is on the line...)
Gotcha. Let's get in fast and crush 'em all.
Yeah, let's. Wyrmbinding, ACTIVATE!
An enemy! We're under attack!
What the—uwaaaaargh!
Th-that's the experimental type of wyrmbound soldier who escaped from the research lab!
Hiiiyah!
Dammit... Such devastating power!
You! Bring the mana cannon here! Not even a wyrmbound soldier could shrug off a direct hit from that!
Yo, Farren! Those mooks just dragged out somethin' that looks real bad!
But we're surrounded by Syndicate soldiers! They can't fire it now, or they'll get their friends caught up in the blast.
As if they give a damn about that, idiot!
FIRE!
Aaaagh!
See? They don't give two nuggets about their so-called pals. And they ain't done!
My body oughta be able to take one or two shots. Once you take a hit, charge right in before they can recoup! Got it?
Urgh...
Second round—FIRE!
Sorry, Lil' Barb! I just can't—
What?!
UWAAAGH!
HA HA HA HA! How do you like THAT?! Even a wyrmbound soldier is toast before the might of this baby!
Hrngh... No... It's not over. It's NOT over!
What in the hell?! That was a direct hit! This kid's some kinda monster...
HRAAAAAH!
Damn...you...
Your cannon is in pieces. You lose. If you don't want to be hurt, then get outta here!
Hrk... Don't you underestimate us!
HIIIYAAAH!
Hrk! For the glory...of the Syndicate...!
*huff* *huff* We managed...to take them all down. Let's get the villagers back...to...
...! Huh? Where...?
Awake at last, huh?
We're back in the village. After you fell, I set the villagers free, and they carried you back here.
O-oh... I see. Thanks, Lil' Barb.
You can stuff your thanks, Farren. What the hell were you thinking? You took that cannon blast with YOUR half of the body.
I, well...
Lemme guess: you were worried about me.
I'm sorry! I just... When I thought about putting you in danger for my sake, I acted without thinking...
Rgh... ＂Without thinking,＂ my scaly butt! You might've been thinking you were gonna protect me, but you ended up doin' exactly the opposite!
If you had gotten smoked by that cannon, it would've left me all alone. D'you think I coulda scrubbed those scrubs without you?
And there's no tellin' what woulda happened to the captive villagers either.
What you ended up doing was throwin' our chance to win into the trash AND putting everyone in danger.
If you wanna go belly-up, be my guest. But try puttin' yourself in the shoes of the folks you get caught up in your nonsense!
I'm sorry. I just...can't stand the idea of watching from the sidelines.
The thought of being the only survivor again on account of my inaction...
...? What are you talking about?
Y'know what? Fine. Do whatever you want. It's got nothin' to do with me.
Huh? How do you figure?
I told you there wouldn't be a next time. I'll pass on pairin' up with a guy who clearly doesn't trust me.
If you wanna die, knock yourself out. Unlike you, I'm still lookin' to stay alive. There's too much I wanna do.
Peace out, guy. This is where we part ways.
Later.
Lil' Barb...
Hey, seconds over here, please! And thirds, while you're at it!
Coming right up!
Aw yeah, it's grub time! *om nom* *munch*
Hee hee. I'm not altogether used to dragon customers, but you certainly don't want for appetite. Glad to know our food pleases.
I'm celebratin' today, y'see. Got myself rid of a real bother, and now I'm free. I gots to enjoy this newfound freedom!
Huh. Well, I may not be privy to the particulars, but I'm sorry to hear you had such a tough time.
Ain't nothin' tough about it. Woulda ended up dead sooner or later, the way things were goin'. Man, that damned Farren...
Did you say ＂Farren＂? As in, the boy who's always running around with a smile on his face? That absolute sweetheart?
What, you know 'im? About yea high, the kinda kid who'd jump out in front of a literal cannon to help somebody else?
That fits his description to a tee, I'd say. Is he doing well?
Fine as he can be, I guess. But so long as he's a terminal soft touch, he's gonna end up in real trouble someday.
I see... I wonder if he's still worried about what happened that day.
Huh? Wait, how well do you know the guy?
We're from the same orphanage, so we grew up together... Kind of like  family, I suppose.
No kiddin'. He musta put you through hell. Ya get jerked around by his antics and all that?
Not really. Farren used to be a very shy boy who didn't talk to anyone.
You gotta be puttin' one over on me! HIM?
It's true. If anything, he was so shy that he'd always wait to see what others did first and then follow suit.
No flippin' way. That's the total opposite of what he's like now.
I think he changed after that incident...
You're gonna need to be more specific.
I think it was when we were about...seven or eight? A number of the children from the orphanage were playing in the mountains when a massive landslide hit.
It looked like the worst-case scenario: that all the children in the area were swept up in the turmoil and killed. But...
They happened to be in a cave at the time. Thank Ilia, right? However, the landslide trapped them inside.
Because they couldn't get out, the adults concluded that the kids must've perished, and so they didn't conduct a search.
But... I think about ten days after...
Another small landslide occurred in the same area, and this time, someone went to check it out. When they did...they heard the voice of a child.
So someone came to the rescue after all.
Yes. But Farren was the only one left to save.
I think it was after that that he changed.
In memory of his friends, y'mean?
Maybe in part. But what he said was that he had given up.
He thought they were beyond help. That nothing they did would actually matter. And so, he did nothing.
The other kids thought differently. They shouted for help as loudly as they could and tried to clear out the blocked entrance.
But making noise or digging around where the earth is loose due to a landslide...can be disastrous. WAS disastrous, in this case.
So the place were they were all diggin' collapsed...
Yes. In the end, all the children who clung to hope died, and the one who did nothing, Farren, survived. Him alone.
He felt that he didn't deserve to be saved, and yet he was the only person who was.
So that's why he did what he did...
I'm sorry. I just...can't stand the idea of watching from the sidelines.
The thought of being the only survivor again on account of my inaction...
Tch. What the heck, man. Nothing's changed at all since back then. He's always been a total knucklehead.
What, does he think it'd be better if he'd gone diggin' with those other kids and gotten himself buried alive?! Like hell!
...Yeah. Nobody would've wanted that.
So ultimately, he doesn't believe in anybody. He's convinced we're all gonna kick the bucket before he does.
But none of us are as weak as he seems to think we are.
Listen. I want you to go and tell Farren that.
What?! Why me?
Because I'm certain he trusts in you.
I don't claim to fully know what's going on, but his actions put you in peril, right?
Do you think that maybe he did that because somewhere in his heart, he knew you'd be okay?
...Tch. Damn kid's nothin' but work.
Hee hee. I guess he is, huh? But that's exactly why we can't just leave him.
Yeah. If we leave him to his own devices, he'll definitely bite the dust. The guy doesn't irk me THAT bad. Bah... I've gotten myself mixed up with one annoying dude.
Tell him I said hello. It makes me happy to see he's made a good friend in you.
I dunno if I'd call us ＂friends,＂ exactly. It's more like...
Farren and I're two hearts beatin' as one! We're partners!
Haaah!
*pant* I somehow managed...to take one down! How many does that leave?
One, two, three—oh crap, so many! But I can't give up, no matter what.
These people need a savior—me! Hraaaaah!
You're tellin' me Farren marched into a Syndicate base?!
Yes. You two were kind enough to rescue us, but that wasn't everyone, I'm afraid.
All the young, healthy men seem to have been taken someplace else.
I see. They musta brought people who'd be easy to experiment on to the base first. And Farren went after 'em, y'say?
Yes. He told us he'd rescue everyone, and not to worry.
You gotta be kiddin' me. Just when I was thinkin' the kid mighta grown a tiny bit of sense without any power to rely on...
He is such a hopeless idiot!
Um... Is everything okay? We're worried that he might be doing something reckless on our account.
Can't deny it. But hey, no need to worry. He and I ain't so weak as to get done in by that buncha goons.
I gotta make sure he understands that too...
*huff* *pant* Looks like I managed to give them the slip.
I can't defeat all the Syndicate soldiers solo, so I've gotta help the villagers and get out of here fast.
Hey, where's your Barbatos B-Unit?
Huh?
You're the prototype wyrmbound soldier. Or the failed prototype, I should say.
Hrk... A Syndicate soldier!
Hey, I'm askin' you what happened to your Barbatos B-Unit.
You mean Lil' Barb? Who knows. I don't have to tell you anyway.
Huh. Well, if he's around, then hurry up and call him so you two can merge.
You sure about that? If I use my wyrmbinding, I'll be able to totally wreck you and make it home in time for lunch.
Yeah, that's right. And I hope you do. Now come on, hurry up and merge with your B-Unit.
(Bluffing's not working...but there are no other soldiers around here. Surely I can take just this one guy on my own...right?)
He not coming? Fine, then I'll go ahead and use my own wyrmbinding first. Come forth, Barbatos B-Unit!
What?! Lil' Barb?! No, wait, that's—
Correct. This ain't YOUR Barbatos B-Unit. This is MY Barbatos B-Unit.
Oh crap... No way!
Wyrmbinding, activate!
Ha ha ha! Witness my power! I'm no failure like you. I am a TRUE wyrmbound soldier!
Uwaaargh!
HA HA HA! POWER! SO MUCH POWER!
Well? Come on. Now it's your turn. I'm ITCHING to test this out and see just how much power I'm working with here!
Urgh... What a mess. Dammit. At this rate, I'm toast...
HEY! Why aren't you using wyrmbinding?! Or are you just unable to? Freakin' boring.
BORING, BORING! If you can't even make a good test subject, then just die in the dirt like the worm you are!
Oh, crap! Not good!
Outta the way, Farren!
Was that...Lil' Barb? It can't be. He...protected me? No way...
Lil' Barb! LIL' BAAAAARB!
Shut UP, man. You're givin' me a headache.
Huh? Lil' Barb? You're...okay?
Right as rain, kid. An attack like that ain't gonna do crap to me.
B-but that looked crazy painful!
Don't believe me, huh? Just take a gander. Ain't a scratch on me.
You're right! Oh, what a relief. I'm so glad you're okay, Lil' Barb!
Sheesh. Dial down the melodrama.
But this means you get it now, right? I ain't so soft that I need you actin' like my human meat shield.
Listen here, Farren. You're a moron.
Huh? Say...what?
You're a bonehead, but a damned impressive guy. You look about as reliable as a hedgehog in a balloon factory, but I get the feelin' you could survive anything.
I believe that you'll be all right, even if I don't lose my mind worryin' about each and every little thing ya do.
I... I don't...
Now what about me? Am I nothing special? Do I look super weak to you?
No! That's not true at all! You ARE impressive. Without you, I'm totally powerless!
Then believe in me. I'm made of sturdier stuff than you think. I ain't gonna burden you with survivor's guilt, ya hear me?
Oh, buddy...!
From now on, BELIEVE in me, you knucklehead!
Yeah... I will. I'm sorry for everything, Lil' Barb. I was so, so wrong.
...Appreciate it. Now let's whoop this fool, Farren!
Yeah! Let's go, Lil' Barb!
Wyrmbinding, activate!
Finally ready to tussle, are we?
You're a real stand-up guy, waitin' for us to use wyrmbinding.
I waited because stepping on insects is boring. Now make sure you struggle enough to make this fun for me!
Here he comes, Lil' Barb!
Right! Don't worry, his attacks barely even tickle. Just use me to stop 'em!
Cocky, aren't we? Fine. I'll give you a little taste and you can see for yourself!
...Heh. See? Told ya. I've had worse pillow fights. Ya see that, pal?! I ain't got a scratch on me!
Rrrgh... You're nothing but a failure! Fine, how about THIS?!
*pant* *huff* How about that, you miserable failure? This is the power of a TRUE wyrmbound soldier...
For ＂true power,＂ it kinda sucks, guy.
Ridiculous... Did I peg him wrong?
Sorry, bud. Right now, the kid and I are loaded with so much power, I'm surprised it ain't comin' out our eyeballs. And on that note, Farren—it's our turn now!
Damn right it is. I can feel the power welling up from deep inside me!
Your strength is mine, kid. When you didn't believe in me, you couldn't unleash our full might.
I get it now... THIS is OUR true power! Come on, Lil' Barb!
Wyrmbinding OVERLOAD!
UWAAAAAAAGH!
Everyone, over here! Hurry!
Looks like nobody from the Syndicate's nippin' at our heels. I think we made it.
Yeah. I'm so relieved. ...Oh, by the way, Lil' Barb?
What?
Thanks for showing up. You saved me.
...Oh, uh. 'Course.
So, er... Ahem. Anyway. If you learned from all this, then think ahead a little before you act next time.
I will. But even if something like this happens again, you'll come for me, right?
D-don't get ahead of yourself. I can't be your babysitter.
Tsk. Somebody needs his mouth washed out with soap. But...I know you've got my back. Right, partner?
No way! I ain't gettin' mixed up in any more of your crazy plans to save everyone you run into!
Come ooon, don't say that. Helping people and seeing them smile is nice, isn't it? Don't you think so?
You're askin' the wrong guy. I'm just sayin', this is the last time I babysit you.
You got that, PARTNER?!
